intro: Ifloga lerouxiae, commonly known as the Leroux's milkweed, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family, which includes many milkweeds and ornamental plants. The plant is characterized by its opposite, ovate leaves and clusters of small, tubular flowers that range in color from white to pink. It produces a milky sap that is typical of the genus, which can be toxic if ingested. Ifloga lerouxiae is often found in grasslands and rocky areas, thriving in well-drained soils.
